title: Allostatic Load: The Cumulative Toll
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Allostatic Load: The Cumulative Toll.

hook.text: Each stressful day adds a little weight. You don't notice. Until one day, the accumulated load collapses you.

buildup.text: Bruce McEwen coined 'allostatic load' â€” the cumulative wear and tear on the body from chronic stress.

discovery.text: Allostatic load explains why people 'suddenly' break down. The load built for months or years before the collapse.

twist.text: High allostatic load predicts cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and cognitive decline â€” even in young workers.

climax.text: Recovery isn't just rest. It's systematically reducing the load: fewer stressors, better recovery, real boundaries.

punchline.text: Stress doesn't reset overnight. The body keeps a running total.
